The only accurate indicator of transition from viral rhinosinusitis to bacterial disease is the duration of symptoms. As a general rule, if rhinosinusitis symptoms are neither better nor worse after 10–14 days, a bacterial infection is more likely and antibiotics are indicated.

They are also called tympanostomy tubes, myringotomy tubes, or pressure-equalization tubes. They can be made of plastic, metal, or Teflon, and some have coatings to reduce the chance of infection.
Hay dos tipos básicos de tubos: corto pl: There are two basic types of tubes: short-term (remain 6 to 12 months before falling out on their own) and long-term (larger, with flanges that keep them in place longer, usually requiring removal by an otolaryngologist).
Se recomiendan cuando un niño experiment: They are recommended when a child experiences repeated middle ear infections (acute otitis media) or hearing loss due to persistent fluid (otitis media with effusion). This can affect speech, balance, and hearing.
También se indican en casos de malformac: They are also indicated in cases of malformations of the eardrum or Eustachian tube, Down syndrome, cleft palate, or barotrauma. Each year, more than half a million ear tube surgeries are performed in children (the most common surgery in childhood), with an average age of 1 to 3 years.
Los tubos restauran la audición, reducen: Tubes restore hearing, reduce the risk of future infections, and improve behavior, sleep, speech, and balance.
La inserción se realiza mediante miringo: Insertion is performed via myringotomy, an outpatient surgical procedure consisting of a 1–2 mm incision in the eardrum. It is performed under a surgical microscope or laser. The tube is placed to keep the hole open and allow ventilation of the middle ear.
Se administra anestesia general ligera (: Light general anesthesia (laughing gas) is administered in young children; some older children may tolerate it without anesthesia. A myringotomy is performed, middle ear fluid is suctioned, and the ventilation tube is placed. The procedure lasts less than 15 minutes.
En algunos casos se recomienda la extrac: In some cases, removal of adenoid tissue is recommended simultaneously to reduce the risk of recurrent infections.

Durante el sueño, el aire que pasa por á: During sleep, air passing through narrow areas in the throat, nose, or mouth vibrates surrounding tissues, producing snoring. It is a very common problem that affects the sleep quality of the person who snores and those sleeping nearby.
